snippet: As the sprawling Zaatari camp evolves into an informal city — with an economy and even gentrification — aid workers say camps can be potential urban incubators that benefit host countries like Jordan.
abstract: Michael Kimmelman Critic's Notebook; displaced Syrians at Zaatari refugee camp in Jordan have turned it into sprawling, do-it-yourself metropolis of 85,000; informal city has neighborhoods, gentrification, growing economy and something approaching normalcy; aid workers say camps can be potential urban incubators that benefit host countries like Jordan.
lead_paragraph: As the sprawling Zaatari camp evolves into an informal city — with an economy and even gentrification — aid workers say camps can be potential urban incubators that benefit host countries like Jordan.

headline.print_headline: Refugee Camp Evolves as a Do-It-Yourself City
headline.main: Refugee Camp for Syrians in Jordan Evolves as a Do-It-Yourself City

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
